Name: Nasi Lemak
Steps: Rinse rice until water runs clear. Drain.
Combine rice, coconut milk, and pandan leaf in a pot. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat to low and cover. Simmer for 15-20 minutes or until rice is cooked.
Serve with cucumber, boiled eggs, fried anchovies, fried peanuts, and sambal.

Name: Char Kway Teow
Steps: Soak rice noodles in hot water until softened. Drain and set aside.
Heat oil in a wok over high heat. Add garlic, prawns, and Chinese sausage. Stir-fry until prawns turn pink.
Push ingredients to one side of the wok. Pour beaten eggs onto the empty side. Scramble until almost set, then mix with other ingredients.
Add rice noodles, soy sauce, oyster sauce, and chili paste. Stir-fry until well combined.
Add bean sprouts and stir-fry for another minute. Serve hot.

Name: Rendang
Steps: Heat oil in a pot. Add blended shallots, garlic, ginger, galangal, and dried chilies. Cook until fragrant.
Add coriander, cumin, and fennel powders. Stir until well combined.
Add beef and cook until it changes color.
Pour in coconut milk, then add lemongrass, kaffir lime leaves, turmeric leaves, cinnamon stick, tamarind paste, salt, and sugar.
Simmer over low heat for 2-3 hours until the beef is tender and the sauce has thickened.
Serve with rice.

Name: Hainanese Chicken Rice
Steps: Rub chicken with salt and rinse. Boil a large pot of water. Submerge the chicken and simmer for about 45 minutes or until cooked. Remove and cool.
Heat oil in a pan. Add minced garlic and saut√© until golden. Add rice and stir until coated with oil.
Transfer rice to a rice cooker. Add chicken broth and cook.
Chop the chicken. Serve with rice, cucumber, and cilantro. Offer soy sauce, sesame oil, ginger paste, and chili sauce on the side.

Name: Nasi Goreng
Ingredients: 1 cup mixed vegetables (e.g., carrots, peas, corn)
Steps: Heat oil in a wok over high heat. Add prawns and cook until pink. Push to one side.
Pour beaten eggs onto the empty side. Scramble until almost set, then mix with prawns.
Add garlic and shallots. Stir-fry until fragrant.
Add mixed vegetables and stir-fry until tender.
Add rice, soy sauce, oyster sauce, and kecap manis. Stir-fry until well combined.
Serve with sliced cucumber and fried shallots on top.

Name: Roti Canai
Steps: In a large bowl, mix flour, salt, condensed milk, and water. Knead until dough is smooth. Divide into balls and let rest for 4 hours.
Grease hands and countertop with ghee. Flatten a dough ball with fingers. Fold and oil again. Repeat until thin.
Heat ghee in a pan. Fry roti until golden brown on both sides. Drain excess oil and serve with dhal or curry.

Name: Satay
Steps: In a bowl, combine lemongrass, garlic, turmeric, coriander, cumin, chili powder, soy sauce, and sugar.
Marinate meat in the mixture for at least 2 hours or overnight.
Thread onto skewers. Grill until cooked. Serve with peanut sauce and rice cakes.

Name: Mee Goreng
Steps: Cook noodles according to package instructions. Drain and set aside.
Heat oil in a wok over high heat. Add prawns and cook until pink. Push to one side.
Pour beaten eggs onto the empty side. Scramble until almost set, then mix with prawns.
Add garlic, bean sprouts, and cooked noodles. Stir-fry until well combined.
Add soy sauce, oyster sauce, and kecap manis. Stir-fry until noodles are evenly coated.
Serve with lime wedges.

Name: Laksa
Steps: Cook rice vermicelli according to package instructions. Drain and set aside.
Blend garlic, shallots, shrimp paste, turmeric, coriander, chili powder, and belacan into a paste.
Heat oil in a pot. Add the paste and cook until fragrant.
Add chicken and cook until no longer pink. Add prawns and cook until they turn pink.
Pour in chicken stock and coconut milk. Simmer until heated through.
Serve over rice vermicelli. Top with bean sprouts, boiled eggs, lime wedges, and herbs.

Name: Murtabak
Steps: In a bowl, combine minced meat, beaten eggs, onions, tomatoes, garlic, shallots, and spices. Mix well.
Place a portion of the mixture on a sheet of roti canai dough. Fold and seal edges.
Heat oil in a pan. Fry murtabak until golden brown on both sides. Serve with curry sauce.

Name: Prawn Mee
Ingredients: 1 liter prawn stock (made from prawn heads and shells)
Steps: Blanch pork ribs in boiling water. Rinse and set aside.
Cook yellow noodles and rice vermicelli according to package instructions. Drain and set aside.
Blend garlic, shallots, shrimp paste, white pepper, chili paste, and sugar into a paste.
Heat oil in a pot. Add the paste and cook until fragrant.
Add pork ribs and prawn stock. Simmer for 30 minutes.
Add prawns and cook until pink.
Serve over noodles with boiled eggs, bean sprouts, and Chinese chives.

Name: Rojak
Steps: Cut fruits into bite-sized pieces. Combine with bean sprouts, tofu, and cucumbers.
Blend shrimp paste, tamarind paste, sugar, chili paste, and belacan into a sauce.
Toss the sauce with the fruits and vegetables. Top with crushed peanuts.

Name: Ais Kacang
Steps: Fill a bowl with ice cubes. Top with red beans, corn kernels, grass jelly, attap chee, and cendol.
Drizzle with rose syrup and sweetened condensed milk. Serve cold.

Name: Kuih Lapis
Steps: Grease a baking dish. Steam for 5 minutes. Mix rice flour, tapioca flour, coconut milk, sugar, and salt.
Divide batter into portions. Add food coloring to each portion.
Pour a layer of the first color into the dish. Steam for 5 minutes. Repeat with other colors.
Cool and cut into squares.

Name: Kaya Toast
Steps: Spread kaya on one side of each bread slice. Press slices together.
In a bowl, whisk eggs with sugar, evaporated milk, and water.
Heat butter in a pan. Dip sandwiches in egg mixture. Fry until golden brown.
Slice and serve.

Name: Pulut Inti
Steps: Rinse rice and soak for 4 hours. Drain.
Steam rice for 30 minutes. Mix with coconut milk and steam for another 15 minutes.
In a pan, melt palm sugar with salt. Add the rice mixture and stir until well combined.
Spoon onto banana leaves and fold into parcels. Serve.

Name: Kerabu Mangga
Steps: In a bowl, combine green mango, dried shrimps, shallots, and chilies.
Mix fish sauce, lime juice, and sugar. Toss with mango mixture.
Garnish with mint leaves. Serve chilled.

Name: Kerabu Taugeh
Steps: In a bowl, combine bean sprouts, boiled eggs, red chilies, and garlic.
Mix fish sauce, lime juice, and sugar. Toss with bean sprout mixture.
Garnish with crushed peanuts and mint leaves. Serve chilled.

Name: Ayam Percik
Steps: Blend shallots, garlic, and red chilies. Mix with coconut milk, tamarind paste, and sugar.
Marinate chicken in the mixture for at least 2 hours or overnight.
Roast chicken until cooked, basting with marinade. Serve hot.

Name: Pisang Goreng
Steps: Peel and slice bananas.
In a bowl, mix flours, sugar, salt, and water to form a batter.
Dip banana slices in batter and fry until golden brown.
Serve hot.
